overview.description: App Store Optimization (ASO) strategies to improve visibility and downloads
overview.goal: Increase organic discovery through App Store search and browsing
key_metrics: Impressions (how many users see app in search/browse)
overview.aso_vs_seo: ASO is SEO for app stores - optimize metadata, visuals, and ratings to rank higher

keyword_optimization.importance: PRIMARY driver of search visibility - 65% of downloads come from search

subtitle.note: includes keywords: track, spending, save, money

keyword_field.strategy: Fill entire 100 chars, no duplicates, comma-separated

description.strategy: Write for users first, include keywords naturally 1-2 times

keyword_research_process: 1. Brainstorm seed keywords (obvious terms for your app type)
2. Analyze competitor keywords (search for competitors, see what they rank for)
3. Use keyword tools to find related terms (App Annie, Sensor Tower, AppTweak)
4. Check search volume and difficulty (high volume + low difficulty = best targets)
5. Prioritize keywords by relevance Ã— volume Ã— achievability
6. Distribute keywords across name, subtitle, keyword field (no duplicates)

head_terms.strategy: Use in app name or subtitle if highly relevant

mid_tail.description: More specific, medium volume, medium competition
mid_tail.strategy: Primary targets for keyword field and subtitle

long_tail.description: Very specific, low volume, low competition
long_tail.strategy: Use if highly relevant to niche audience

keyword_mistakes: Keyword stuffing in app name (looks spammy, Apple may reject)
Using brand names you don't own (trademark violation)
Irrelevant keywords (attracts wrong users, hurts conversion)

testing_keywords.method: Product Page Optimization (A/B testing in App Store Connect)

visual_optimization.importance: PRIMARY driver of conversion - users decide in 3-7 seconds

app_icon_aso.role: Stand out in search results and category browsing
best_practices: Avoid text (hard to read at small sizes)
Test multiple designs with target users
app_icon_aso.a_b_testing: Use Product Page Optimization to test icon variants

screenshots_aso.role: Convince users to download after they view app page
screenshots_aso.first_3_critical: First 3 screenshots appear in search results - make them compelling
best_practices: Show app in use (not just features list)
Highlight main value proposition in first screenshot

captions.content: 1 sentence benefit, not just feature name

screenshot_order: Screenshot 4-6: Additional features or use cases
Screenshot 7-10: Social proof, testimonials, or edge cases
screenshots_aso.testing: A/B test screenshot order and captions with Product Page Optimization

app_preview_videos.role: Show app in action, increase engagement
app_preview_videos.specs: 15-30 seconds, MOV/M4V/MP4, same resolution as screenshots
best_practices: No live-action footage of people (focus on app)
Add captions (many users watch without sound)
app_preview_videos.when_to_use: Complex apps that benefit from demonstration (games, productivity tools)

optimization_strategies.improve_screenshots: Lead with strongest value prop, add captions
optimization_strategies.improve_ratings: Prompt satisfied users to rate (in-app prompt), respond to reviews
optimization_strategies.improve_description: Clearer benefits in first paragraph, better formatting
optimization_strategies.reduce_friction: Minimize file size, avoid high age rating if possible

a_b_testing_with_ppo.feature: Product Page Optimization (in App Store Connect)
process: 1. Create alternative product page in App Store Connect
2. Select elements to test (icon, screenshots, etc.)
6. Apply winning variant to default page
best_practices: Test one element at a time (icon OR screenshots, not both)
Let test run full duration before concluding

ratings_and_reviews.importance: CRITICAL for both search ranking and conversion
ratings_and_reviews.ranking_impact: Higher avg rating = better search ranking
ratings_and_reviews.conversion_impact: Apps with 4+ stars convert 3-5x better than <3 stars

in_app_rating_prompt.timing: After positive experience (completed task, achieved goal)
in_app_rating_prompt.frequency: Apple limits prompts to 3x per year per user
best_practices: Prompt after user success (not immediately on launch)
Don't force or incentivize ratings (against policy)
example_timing: After 3rd successful expense entry (for budget app)
After completing first workout (for fitness app)

respond_to_reviews.importance: Shows users you care, can improve rating
response_guidelines: Offer solutions or ask for more info (via support)

example_responses.positive: Thank you for the 5-star review! We're thrilled you love [APP_NAME]. ðŸŽ‰
example_responses.negative: We're sorry to hear about this issue. Please contact us at [EMAIL] so we can help resolve this. Thank you for your patience.

methods: Deliver excellent user experience (reduces negative reviews)
Fix bugs quickly (respond to crash reports)
Provide great customer support (turn frustrated users into fans)

handling_negative_reviews: 1. Read review carefully, identify root issue
2. Respond publicly with apology and solution
3. Invite user to contact support for personalized help
4. Fix underlying issue in next app update
5. Follow up with user after fix (they may update review)

localization_for_aso.importance: Localized apps see 50-100% more downloads in localized markets
what_to_localize: App name (adapt for local language, if brand allows)
App preview videos (local voiceover or captions)

keyword_research_per_locale.critical: Don't just translate keywords - research local search terms
keyword_research_per_locale.example: In US: 'expense tracker'. In UK: 'spending tracker'. In China: 'è®°è´¦' (ji zhang)
keyword_research_per_locale.tools: App Store search suggestions in each locale, local ASO tools

cultural_considerations: Colors (red = luck in China, danger in US)
Pricing (show local currency in screenshots if applicable)

category_and_subcategory.importance: Determines where app appears in App Store browsing
selection_strategy: Choose primary category where app fits best (not where competition is lowest)
Add secondary category to increase browse discoverability
Consider user behavior (where do they browse?)

factors: Downloads (velocity matters - recent downloads weighted higher)
Ratings and reviews (quantity and avg rating)
ranking_in_category.strategy: Aim for top 200 in category to get featured, top 50 for significant traffic

custom_product_pages.feature: Create multiple versions of app page for different audiences (iOS 15+)
use_cases: Different campaigns (social media, email, paid ads)
Different features highlighted (budget focus vs investment focus)

example.custom_page_1: Wedding budget focus (for wedding planning campaigns)
example.custom_page_2: Small business expense tracking (for business ads)

implementation: 1. Create custom product page in App Store Connect
3. Get unique URL for custom page
4. Use URL in specific campaigns (social ads, email, QR codes)

app_store_featuring.importance: Featured apps get 10-50x more downloads during featuring period
how_to_increase_chances: Submit for consideration (app-editorial@apple.com with press kit)

keyword_research.name: App Annie (now data.ai)
keyword_research.features: Keyword rankings, competitor analysis, download estimates

keyword_research.name: Sensor Tower
keyword_research.features: Keyword optimization, ASO reports, competitive intelligence

keyword_research.name: AppTweak
keyword_research.features: Keyword suggestions, search volume, difficulty scores

keyword_research.name: Mobile Action
keyword_research.features: ASO tools, ad intelligence, market research

a_b_testing.name: SplitMetrics
a_b_testing.features: Advanced A/B testing for app store pages

analytics.name: App Store Connect Analytics
analytics.metrics: Impressions, downloads, conversion rate, sources, retention

keyword_rankings.metric: Position in search results for each target keyword
keyword_rankings.goal: Top 10 for main keywords, top 30 for secondary

impressions.metric: How many users see app in App Store
impressions.interpretation: Low impressions = need better keyword optimization or category selection

conversion_rate.source: App Store Connect > Analytics > Conversion Rate
conversion_rate.interpretation: Low conversion = need better visuals or ratings

organic_downloads.metric: Downloads from App Store search and browse

ratings_distribution.source: App Store Connect > Ratings and Reviews
ratings_distribution.interpretation: Too many 1-3 stars = UX or feature issues

monthly_tasks: 1. Review keyword rankings (ASO tool or App Store search tests)
2. Analyze conversion rate and impressions (App Store Connect)
3. Read new reviews, respond to recent ones
4. Test new keywords or metadata (if conversion is low)
5. Update promotional text (if seasonal or new feature)
quarterly_tasks: 1. Major keyword refresh (research new terms, drop underperforming ones)
2. Screenshot refresh (A/B test new designs or messaging)
3. Localization review (add new languages or update existing)
4. Competitive analysis (check what top competitors are doing)
continuous_tasks: Fix bugs and improve UX (reduce negative reviews)

step_1_keyword_generation.ai_prompt: Generate 50 keyword ideas for [APP_NAME], a [CATEGORY] app for [TARGET_AUDIENCE]. Include head terms, mid-tail, and long-tail keywords. Output as CSV.

step_2_keyword_prioritization.task: Score keywords by relevance, volume, difficulty
step_2_keyword_prioritization.method: Use ASO tool API or manual research

step_3_keyword_distribution.task: Distribute keywords across name, subtitle, keyword field
rules: Keywords 6-20 in keyword field (100 chars total)

step_4_screenshot_caption_generation.ai_prompt: Write 10 screenshot captions for [APP_NAME]. Each caption: 1 sentence, highlight benefit (not feature), engaging tone. Screenshots show: [LIST_OF_SCREENS]
